description: Creates a new Timestream for InfluxDB DB instance.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name that uniquely identifies the DB instance when interacting with the Amazon Timestream for InfluxDB API and CLI commands. This name will also be a prefix included in the endpoint. DB instance names must be unique per customer and per region.

parameters.name: password
parameters.description: The password of the initial admin user created in InfluxDB. This password will allow you to access the InfluxDB UI to perform various administrative tasks and also use the InfluxDB CLI to create an operator token. These attributes will be stored in a Secret created in Secrets Manager in your account.

parameters.name: dbInstanceType
parameters.description: The Timestream for InfluxDB DB instance type to run InfluxDB on.

parameters.name: vpcSubnetIds
parameters.description: A list of VPC subnet IDs to associate with the DB instance. Provide at least two VPC subnet IDs in different availability zones when deploying with a Multi-AZ standby. (string) ---

parameters.name: vpcSecurityGroupIds
parameters.description: A list of VPC security group IDs to associate with the DB instance. (string) ---

parameters.name: dbStorageType
parameters.description: The Timestream for InfluxDB DB storage type to read and write InfluxDB data. You can choose between 3 different types of provisioned Influx IOPS included storage according to your workloads requirements: Influx IO Included 3000 IOPS Influx IO Included 12000 IOPS Influx IO Included 16000 IOPS.

parameters.name: allocatedStorage
parameters.description: The amount of storage to allocate for your DB storage type in GiB (gibibytes).

parameters.name: logDeliveryConfiguration
parameters.description: Configuration for sending InfluxDB engine logs to a specified S3 bucket. Configuration for S3 bucket log delivery. The name of the S3 bucket to deliver logs to. Indicates whether log delivery to the S3 bucket is enabled.

nested_params.name: s3Configuration
nested_params.description: Configuration for S3 bucket log delivery.

nested_params.name: bucketName
nested_params.description: The name of the S3 bucket to deliver logs to.

nested_params.name: enabled
nested_params.description: Indicates whether log delivery to the S3 bucket is enabled.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: A list of key-value pairs to associate with the DB instance. (string) --- (string) ---

parameters.name: port
parameters.description: The port number on which InfluxDB accepts connections. Valid Values: 1024-65535 Default: 8086 Constraints: The value can't be 2375-2376, 7788-7799, 8090, or 51678-51680

nested_items.name: id
nested_items.description: A service-generated unique identifier.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The customer-supplied name that uniquely identifies the DB instance when interacting with the Amazon Timestream for InfluxDB API and CLI commands.

nested_items.name: arn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the DB instance.

nested_items.name: status
nested_items.description: The status of the DB instance.

nested_items.name: endpoint
nested_items.description: The endpoint used to connect to InfluxDB. The default InfluxDB port is 8086.

nested_items.name: port
nested_items.description: The port number on which InfluxDB accepts connections. The default value is 8086.

nested_items.name: networkType
nested_items.description: Specifies whether the networkType of the Timestream for InfluxDB instance is IPV4, which can communicate over IPv4 protocol only, or DUAL, which can communicate over both IPv4 and IPv6 protocols.

nested_items.name: dbInstanceType
nested_items.description: The Timestream for InfluxDB instance type that InfluxDB runs on.

nested_items.name: dbStorageType
nested_items.description: The Timestream for InfluxDB DB storage type that InfluxDB stores data on.

nested_items.name: allocatedStorage
nested_items.description: The amount of storage allocated for your DB storage type (in gibibytes).

nested_items.name: deploymentType
nested_items.description: Specifies whether the Timestream for InfluxDB is deployed as Single-AZ or with a MultiAZ Standby for High availability.

nested_items.name: vpcSubnetIds
nested_items.description: A list of VPC subnet IDs associated with the DB instance.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: publiclyAccessible
nested_items.description: Indicates if the DB instance has a public IP to facilitate access.

nested_items.name: vpcSecurityGroupIds
nested_items.description: A list of VPC security group IDs associated with the DB instance.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: dbParameterGroupIdentifier
nested_items.description: The id of the DB parameter group assigned to your DB instance.

nested_items.name: availabilityZone
nested_items.description: The Availability Zone in which the DB instance resides.

nested_items.name: secondaryAvailabilityZone
nested_items.description: The Availability Zone in which the standby instance is located when deploying with a MultiAZ standby instance.

nested_items.name: logDeliveryConfiguration
nested_items.description: Configuration for sending InfluxDB engine logs to send to specified S3 bucket.

nested_items.name: s3Configuration
nested_items.description: Configuration for S3 bucket log delivery.

nested_items.name: bucketName
nested_items.description: The name of the S3 bucket to deliver logs to.

nested_items.name: enabled
nested_items.description: Indicates whether log delivery to the S3 bucket is enabled.

nested_items.name: influxAuthParametersSecretArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Secrets Manager secret containing the initial InfluxDB authorization parameters. The secret value is a JSON formatted key-value pair holding InfluxDB authorization values: organization, bucket, username, and password.

nested_items.name: dbClusterId
nested_items.description: Specifies the DbCluster to which this DbInstance belongs to.

nested_items.name: instanceMode
nested_items.description: Specifies the DbInstance's role in the cluster.
